0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• NOT indicated in management of acute hyperammonemia
  • doses exceeding 20 grams daily have not been evaluated with respect to efficacy or safety
  • sodium content of Buphenyl(R) powder: 11.7 grams sodium per 100 grams of powder which (125 milligrams sodium/gram of sodium phenylbutyrate)
  • sodium content of Buphenyl(R) tablet: 62 milligrams sodium (124 milligrams sodium/gram of sodium phenylbutyrate)
  • Disorder of the urea cycle metabolism; Adjunct: 9.9 to 13 gram/m(2)/DAY ORALLY equally divided with each meal or feeding 3 to 6 times daily

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• NOT indicated in management of acute hyperammonemia
  • doses exceeding 20 grams daily have not been evaluated with respect to efficacy or safety
  • sodium content of Buphenyl(R) powder: 11.7 grams sodium per 100 grams of powder (125 milligrams sodium/gram of sodium phenylbutyrate)
  • sodium content of Buphenyl(R) tablet: 62 milligrams sodium (124 milligrams sodium/gram of sodium phenylbutyrate)
  • Disorder of the urea cycle metabolism; Adjunct: less than 20 kg, 450 to 600 mg/kg/DAY ORALLY equally divided with each meal or feeding 3 to 6 times daily
  • Disorder of the urea cycle metabolism; Adjunct: larger patients, 9.9 to 13 gram/m(2)/DAY ORALLY equally divided with each meal or feeding 3 to 6 times daily

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Disorder of the urea cycle metabolism; Adjunct

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hyperammonemia, acute; do not use for emergency management
  • hypersensitivity to sodium phenylbutyrate or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• beta oxidation, inborn errors of; required for drug metabolism
  • heart failure; sodium in tablets and powder, worsening of sodium retention and edema may occur
  • hepatic insufficiency; primary site for drug metabolism
  • renal insufficiency, severe; sodium in tablets and powder, worsening of sodium retention and edema may occur
  • renal insufficiency; primary site for drug metabolism and excretion

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Endocrine metabolic:Acidosis (14%), Hypoalbuminemia (11%)
  • Hematologic:Anemia (9%)
  • Reproductive:Amenorrhea (23%), Irregular periods (23%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Cardiac dysrhythmia, Syncope (less than 2%)
  • Endocrine metabolic:Hypokalemia (1%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Pancreatitis, Rectal hemorrhage
  • Hematologic:Aplastic anemia, Thrombocytopenia (3%), Thrombocytosis (1%)
  • Renal:Renal tubular acidosis (less than 2%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Sodium phenylbutyrate is a prodrug and is rapidly metabolized to phenylacetate, the active form. Phenylacetate conjugates with glutamine via acetylation to form phenylacetylglutamine, which provides a different vehicle for nitrogen waste excretion by the kidneys. Thus, sodium phenylbutyrate decreases elevated plasma ammonia glutamine concentrations in patients with urea cycle disorders.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Phenylacetate (active metabolite), Tmax, Oral (tablets and powder): 3.55 to 3.74 hours
  • Phenylacetate (active metabolite), Tmax, IV: 30 to 60 minutes

sub.title: Distribution
sub.mono:
• phenylbutyrate (prodrug) and phenylacetylglutamine (metabolite), Vd: 0.2 L/kg
  • phenylacetate (active metabolite), Vd: 0.3 L/kg

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Hepatic and renal: rapid and extensive.
  • Phenylacetate: active metabolite.

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal: 80 to 100% as phenylacetylglutamine.
  • Total body clearance: 18 mg/hour/kg

sub.title: Elimination Half Life
sub.mono:
• Phenylacetate (active metabolite): 1.15 to 1.29 hours
  • Sodium phenylbutyrate (prodrug): 0.76 to 0.77 hours

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • powder may be mixed with solid food, liquid food, or water; give orally via mouth, gastrostomy, or nasogastric tube only; shake lightly before use.
  • powder: once mixed with food, give immediately; if mixed with water, may be stored at room temperature or refrigerated and given within 1 week

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Counsel patient with congestive heart failure or renal failure that product contains significant amounts of sodium and may cause edema.
  • Drug may cause amenorrhea, menstrual dysfunction, body odor, or changes in taste.
  • Instruct patient or caregiver to immediately report signs/symptoms of hyperammonemia (eg, irritability, poor feeding, or vomiting in infant; unstable gait, irritability, sleep disturbances, or hyperactivity in older children/adults).
  • Advise patient to adhere to dietary restrictions with respect to protein intake or additional supplements if needed.
  • Advise patient that drug should be taken in equally divided amounts with food.
  • Instruct patient to take a missed dose as soon as possible on the same day.
